title: Top US court refuses to review anti-BDS law. Here’s what it means
description: The decision does not necessarily mean that the Supreme Court thinks anti-BDS laws are constitutional, experts say.

title: Mexico’s former public security chief convicted in US drug case
description: Genaro Garcia Luna was found guilty of accepting millions of dollars in bribes from drug-trafficking cartels in Mexico.

title: Daughter of Malcolm X to sue agencies for alleged role in slaying
description: Ilyasah Shabazz says that she plans to sue the NYPD and the FBI, among others, for $100m in a wrongful death lawsuit.

title: Biden rallies behind Kyiv as Putin freezes nuclear deal with US
description: US leader repeats his support for Ukriane as Russian president says Moscow is suspending the New START treaty.

title: Russia’s military brass accused of ‘treason’ by Wagner chief
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin says the Russian army is starving his fighters of ammunition and they are 'dropping like flies'.

title: Last rallies held in Lagos ahead of Nigeria presidential election
description: Ruling party candidate promises hope, opposition pledges change as Thursday's deadline to end campaigns approaches.

title: What’s behind latest Afghanistan-Pakistan border tension?
description: The two neighbours closed a major crossing at Torkham in their most recent border dispute.

title: US Supreme Court hears arguments in internet legal immunity case
description: Family of a student killed in the 2015 Paris attacks has sued YouTube for promoting videos created by ISIL fighters.

title: India’s Sania Mirza bows out of tennis after shock loss in Dubai
description: The six-time Grand Slam winner from India had announced plans to retire after playing in the Dubai Open.

title: Russia calls UN meeting on Nord Stream pipeline ‘sabotage’
description: Russia alleges the US was behind the attack and it occurred after 'repeated threats' by American leaders.

title: US home sales drop to more than 12-year low in January
description: January marked the 12th straight monthly decline in sales of existing homes, the longest such stretch since 1999.

title: Four-day workweek trial in UK: Shorter hours, happier employees
description: Findings show companies' reported revenue largely stayed the same, or even rose, over the June to December trial period.

title: Death toll from flooding in Brazil rises to 44
description: Rescue work continues after a torrential downpour brought flooding and landslides to coastal area of Sao Paulo state.

title: Ukraine war will ‘never be a victory for Russia’, Biden says

title: Shifting the blame: Ukraine responds to Vladimir Putin address
description: To Ukrainian observers, threat of a new Cold War is just a bluff aimed at disguising the Russian leader's desperation.

title: California mulls statewide standards for religious garb in jails
description: Advocacy groups say 'common sense' bill would help protect incarcerated people's right to religious freedom, expression.

title: Dalits are winning against caste discrimination in the US, too
description: A Seattle City Council resolution against caste discrimination is an important step in this journey.

title: Three UN peacekeepers killed by roadside bomb in Mali
description: Five soldiers serving in world's deadliest UN mission seriously wounded when convoy hits an improvised explosive device.

title: UN urges Israel to ‘pause’ controversial legislative overhaul
description: World body concerned that changes would risk effectiveness of the judiciary to defend the rule of law, human rights.

title: Ten times countries decided to exit international agreements

description: Iran says Jamshid Sharmahd masterminded a bombing that killed 14 people, something his family denies.

title: Putin rages against West in speech decried as absurd propaganda
description: Russian leader says he will pull Moscow out of a nuclear treaty and blames Ukraine for the invasion he started.

title: Panic injures many as traumatised Syria hit by new earthquakes

title: After Sturgeon, what remains of Scotland’s independence bid?
description: Health Secretary Humza Yousaf and Finance Secretary Kate Forbes, both below 40, are standing to succeed Sturgeon.

title: Survivors in Turkey say ‘new normal’ is coping with more quakes
description: The illusion of lives being rebuilt was shattered with new tremblers that reawakened recent traumas.

title: Pakistan’s president slammed for declaring poll date in provinces
description: Arif Alvi's unilateral decision to announce April 9 elections in Punjab and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa triggers new controversy.

title: Turkey’s ‘aid diplomacy’ reverberates in global quake response
description: Analysts say ruling AK Party has for years built influence and global clout with humanitarian-heavy foreign policy.

title: Nigeria 2023 election: All you need to know
description: There are 93.4 million eligible voters for February 25 polls, the sixth since Nigeria's return to democracy in 1999.

title: New tremors add to misery in quake-affected Turkey, Syria
description: At least six killed and more than 300 reported injured after quakes hit Turkey-Syria border region, causing panic.

title: Defacing Dahl
description: Editing Roald Dahl children's books in order to allegedly 'modernise' them is a sacrilege.

title: Putin’s state-of-the-nation speech: What exactly did he say?
description: President Putin blames the West and Ukraine for the war he ordered a year ago.

title: Electricity bill hike adds to misery of Sri Lankans amid crisis
description: The 66 percent price increase is latest measure by island nation to clinch a $2.9bn IMF loan to tackle economic crisis.

title: Russian economy shrank 2.1% in 2022, much less than expected
description: The economy defied fears of a recession and previous predictions that it would contract by more than 12 percent.

title: Palestinian teen succumbs to Israeli gunshot wounds
description: Muntaser al-Shawwa was severely wounded two weeks ago, with his family accusing the Israeli army of ‘shooting to kill’.

title: Crackdown on child marriage tears families apart in India’s Assam
description: More than 3,000 people arrested this month, with state's BJP government accused of targeting Muslims in ongoing drive.

description: President says allies working closely together to deal with global challenges including 'authoritarian expansionism'.

title: India invokes emergency law to force coal plants to boost output

title: PNG police launch rescue operation for researchers held hostage
